In a large bowl, combine condensed milk, sugar, egg yolk, vanilla, flour, baking powder, salt, peppermint extract, miniature chocolate chip, red food coloring. Blend well. Gradually fold in whipped cream. Add chocolate chips and mix well. Pour into a 9x5-inch freezer container. Cover and freeze at least 6 hours.

Preheat oven to 375f mix cream cheese and 2 tablespoons of the honey. Stir in almonds. Spread 1 rounded tablespoons cream cheese mixture onto each triangle. Roll up each loosely, starting at shortest side of triangle, rolling to opposite point. Place rolls on ungreased baking sheet. Curve each into crescent shape. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bale 12 to 14 minute or until golden brown. Serve rolls warm, drizzled with remaining honey.

Heat oven to 400 f. Combine the oil, garlic, sugar, cumin, salt, cinnamon, and carrots in a shallow baking pan. Roast 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove from oven and add the raisins, lemon juice, and parsley. Toss well.

Place crab in food processor and process until it is in small pieces. Remove to mixing bowl. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Chill until served. Arrange cracker assortment around plate, outside of salad ring.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together all ingredients from ground beef, onion, pizza sauce, sliced mushrooms, oregano, italian seasoning, salt, mozzarella cheese, monterey jack cheese, hamburger bunspreparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, toss potatoes, garlic, and olive oil together to coat. Place potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Place in 350 degree oven for 15-20 minutes, or until tender, allow to cool for 10 minutes. Combine mayonnaise, creole mustard, lemon juice, parsley, and scallions. Add to potatoes. Add salt or pepper to taste. Serve cold or room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Mix the flour, baking powder, and baking soda together in a bowl. Set the mixture aside. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla, mix well. Gradually beat in the flour mixture then add chocolate chips. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes. Let cookies rest on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing with a spatula to wire racks to cool completely.

Heat oil in a nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray and cook turkey for 6 minutes. Drain. Add hot sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 3-5 minutes or until sauce is thickened and turkey is no longer pink in center. Place lettuce on warm tortillas and drizzle dressing on top. Roll up and serve.

Spray a large frying with cooking spray then cook the walnuts until no longer pink. Mix in the water, taco seasoning, & salsa, simmer for 5 minutes. Add in the cheese then stir until melted. Turn off the heat & stir in the sour cream. Spoon the walnuts onto the tortilla shells, top with the tomato & lettuce, if using.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Toss well. Combine sugar and remaining ingredients in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk. Pour vinegar mixture over cabbage mixture, tossing gently to combine. Cover. Chill 1 hour.

Heat oil in a nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray and cook chicken for 6 minutes. Drain. Add hot sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 3-5 minutes or until sauce is thickened and chicken is no longer pink in center. Place lettuce on warm tortillas and drizzle dressing on top. Roll up and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray bottom of baking dish with cooking spray, sprinkle three cups of the has browns in bottom of dish. Layer with ham cheese, bell peppers and mushrooms. Sprinkle remaining potatoes on top. Beat eggs and milk with wire wisk, add cottage cheese and pepper. Pour over mixture in baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Sprinkle remaining cheese over top of casserole. Bake for additional 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter and saute until butter is melted. Add parmesan cheese and saute until cheese is melted, about 2 minutes. Add milk and saute until cheese is melted, about 2 minutes. Add parmesan cheese and saute until

Preheat oven to 350f line a baking sheet with parchment paper & set aside. In a large mixing bowl, add the brown sugar, shortening, and margarine. Beat until fluffy. Add in the vanilla and eggs. Mix until well blended. Add in the flours, and baking powder. Stir to mix. Add in the oats. Stir well to mix. Drop heaping tablespoonfuls of dough 2-inches apart onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 10-14 minutes or until a light golden brown. Cool for 1 minute, then transfer to cooling rack.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut up the apples into small chunks and place them on the bottom of a lightly greased pie pan. Combine the sugar, flour, eggs, vanilla sugar and half of the vanilla into a bowl and mix well. Pour the mixture over the apples and sprinkle with remaining vanilla. Put into preheated oven for 20-30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees f and bake for 15 minutes. Top with cool whip or whipped cream when pie is completely cool, or slice and add topping on individual slices when serving.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix together all ingredients together. Pour into a greased 8 inch square casserole. Bake for 35 minutes. Sprinkle crumbled pralines on top and bake another 12 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes, then cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spread chops or full rack of ribs in roasting pan. Mix honey mustard, ketchup, lemon and herb spice, and dices garlic. Spread mixture over meat. Place cut onion over meat and sauce. Spinkle black pepper over entire dish. Bake for 30-40 minutes, until tender. Serve with your choice of vegetables for a little sweeter sauce add granulated sugar to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 9 x 13 pan with non stick spray. Place chicken breast on bottom of 9x13 baking pan. Pour soup mix over top. Spoon stuffing on top. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Uncover bake an additional 5 to 10 minutes.

In a large skillet, saut onion in margarine for 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and continue to cook 1 minute more. Reduce heat to low and stir in cheese just until melted. Remove from heat and stir in olives. Cool to room temperature. Place one teaspoon of filling on each wonton wrapper. Dampen all corners of wrapper and pinch diagonal corners together to form a square, being careful to seal. Deep fry a few at a time for 1-2 minutes until golden, turning once. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels. Immediately sprinkle lightly with seasoned salt. Serve with salsa.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray a pan large enough to hold the chops in a single layer with non-stick spray. Season the pork steaks or chops with salt& pepper. Arrange them in single layer in the prepared pan. Cover and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the chops from the pan and pour off the fat. Place the apples in the pan and top with the baked chops. Bake uncovered, basting occasionally, for 45 minutes or until pork is tender.

Place tomatoes in food processor. Process on high for 1 minute. In dutch oven on medium heat, saut onions in olive oil till soft but not browned. Add tomatoes, tomato pure and all spices. Cook sauce on very low heat for about 2 hours, stirring occasionally. Add a little water if necessary as sauce cooks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place 2 tablespoons butter in each of two 9-inch pie plates. Heat in oven until melted. Stir together bisquick, milk and eggs. Arrange half of the peach slices in each pie plate. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until puffed and golden brown. High altitude no changes.

Preheat oven to 200d celsius lightly grease 4 ramekins and place on a baking tray. Heat a medium sized fry pan over a moderate heat and add the oil to the pan, then add the spinach and season with salt and pepper. Cook until the leaves are just softened. Drain the spinach in a colander and as soon as spinach is cool enough to handle, squeeze out excess liquid. Divide the spinach between the ramekins and break two eggs on top of the spinach. Pour one tablespoon of cream over the eggs and sprinkle with one tablespoon of parmesan. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the eggs are set and puffed up. Serve immediately with toast.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly grease 9x9 inch baking dish. Combine the artichoke hearts, feta, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, pimientos, and garlic in a bowl. Blend thoroughly. Spoon into prepared baking dish. Bake in preheated oven until top is bubbly and lightly browned, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove and garnish with tomatoes and green onions.

Combine all ingredients in a large pitcher, stirring until sugar dissolves. Taste at this point and if you want it a little sweeter, add a little bit more sugar. Add fruit slices and cranberries. Cover and chill at least 8 hours. Mix together all ingredients in a large pitcher, stirring until sugar dissolves. Add

Heat oil and butter in a large skillet. Add shrimp and onion. Stir while cooking until shrimp are coated. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Saute 2-3 minutes or until shrimp turn pink. Turn shrimp with spatula. Cook shrimp in single layer for about 1 minute on each side until cooked through. After all shrimp is cooked and removed from pan, deglaze pan with 3 t of lemon juice, stirring up any browned bits. Pour sauce over shrimp and serve.

Combine the sugar, butter and butter in a saucepan. Bring mixture to a rolling boil stirring constantly. Remove pan from heat and stir in white chocolate chips until completely melted. Add marshmallow creme and walnuts. Beat by hand until completely blended. Spread into a greased 9x9 pan.

In a separate pan cover 3 diced and peeled potatoes with water and simmer until tender. Drain water and mix until cooked potatoes are a thick liquid. In a large pot, add vegetable broth, potato diced with peel, onion, carrots, and celery. Stir and cook until potatoes are soft. Add liquefied potatoes, cooked cream corn, bay leaf, and paprika, stir. Add green onions, stir.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, butter, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, flour. Add to the creamed mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven about 15 minutes or until lightly brown.

Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl. Pour over chex mixture, mixing well to coat. Microwave on high for 6 minutes, stirring every 2 minutes. Drain on paper towels that have been put on top of newspaper.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until onion is translucent, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes with their liquid, pinto beans, lima beans, brown sugar, salt and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until lima beans are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in white kidney beans, heat through. To serve, ladle soup into warm serving bowl. Sprinkle with 1 to 2 ounces shredded cheddar cheese if desired.

Preheat oven to 350. Lightly grease or spray with pam a 9-inch pie plate. Press all the water out of the thawed spinach. Combine cottage cheese, cheddar cheese, spinach, eggs, oil, salt and pepper. Pour half of the mixture into the lightly greased pie plate. Bake 40 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Rinse and dry chicken and sprinkle with salt and pepper inside the cavity as much as you like. Place the lemon and ginger slices and garlic cloves inside the cavity. Place in a shallow roasting pan and rub on some olive oil. Season the outside with more salt and pepper. Roast 15 minutes then decrease heat to 375 degrees. Roast an additional 65 minutes. Place in a shallow roasting

In a large skillet sprayed with butter-flavored cooking spray, brown meat and onion. Add beef and brown. Sprinkle with flour and cook an additional minute. Add water, wine, soup mix and bouillon and stir. Transfer to casserole dish with lid and bake at 325f for 3 hours. Ensure it does not go dry by adding wine or water. Fry mushrooms in pan with 1 tbsp olive oil. Fry mushrooms in pan with

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 9x13 pan. Beat eggs, sugar and oil, together. Add flour, baking soda and cinnamon. Mix well. Add apples and walnuts, mix together. Pour into prepared pan. Bake 40 to 45 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla, mixing well. In a separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Stir in pecans. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 11-14 minutes or until light golden. Transfer cookies to wire rack to cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray muffin pan with cooking spray. Beat sugar and eggs together until thickened. Add melted butter and almond extract. Beat well. Add flour. Stir in cranberries and pecans. Fill muffin pan. Since these do not raise much fill the cups to the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until browned on top and done in center. Cool on wire rack.

Heat 1 tablespoon of butter in frying pan over medium heat. Add egg and fry until cooked to your preference. In a nonstick pan, fry ham until warm and lightly brown. Remove from pan and keep warm. On one slice of sourdough bread, layer slice of cheddar cheese, ham, slice of swiss cheese and fried egg. Top with other slice of bread. Brush melted butter on sandwich and place buttered side down in skillet used to fry ham. Brush melted butter on top. After a few minutes, flip sandwich over and fry until golden brown and cheese is melted.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, add butter. While whisking, slowly add in flour. When blended, add salt, pepper, nutmeg and cayenne. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, whisking constantly. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes or until thickened and bubbly. Mix in the parmesan cheese. Season with salt and lots of black pepper.

Heat oven to 350°F. Add olive oil to a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions are a deep golden color, about 20 minutes. Add balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper. Cook until most of the moisture evaporates and onions are deep brown, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, steam or microwave the cauliflower until tender but still firm. Add cauliflower, green onions and pepper. Mix well until vegetables are evenly coated with dressing. Add salt and pepper to taste. Chill 30 mins.

Place peach lavender jam in sterilized jars, seal and process in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes. Place jars on a towel on your counter and let cool overnight. Remove from heat, stir in the pectin and ladle into hot sterilized jars. Seal and process in a hot water bath for 10 minutes. Remove from heat, stir

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut ribs into serving sizes. Place in greased roasting pan. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. In a saucepan combine the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, cook for one minute. Drain grease from ribs. Pour sauce over ribs. Cover and bake 1 hour. Uncover, bake for 30 minutes longer, basting twice.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Place tomatoes on a rimmed baking sheet, cut side up. Drizzle with oil, and sprinkle with thyme leaves. Season with salt and pepper. Roast until tomatoes begin to collapse, brushing occasionally with pan juices.

Place the pasta, chicken, pesto, and bell peppers in a saucepan. Heat over low heat, stirring frequently, until hot. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with olives and sprinkle a little parmesan cheese on top.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cut slits diagonally in loaf with sharp knife. Brush with egg white. Bake in preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, until golden brown and when you knock the bottom of bread it sounds hollow. Bake in preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, until golden brown and

In a large nonmetal dish or resealable food storage plastic bag, combine all ingredients except steak. Mix well. Add steak and turn to coat. Cover dish or seal bag. Refrigerate atleast 4 hours or overnight to marinate. Serve over dinner rolls.

Preheat oven to 350f and lightly grease a casserole dish. Cover chinese cabbage with boiling water and cook for about ten minutes or until tender. Drain very well. Pour into a baking dish, cover and bake in oven for 30 to 40 minutes.

Heat oven to 475 f. Spray a roasting rack and shallow roasting pan with nonstick spray or grease lightly with some oil. Remove skin from chicken, rinse well, and pat dry. Using a pastry brush, coat both sides of each piece of chicken well with the salad dressing. Bake 20 minutes, then flip pieces over using a pair of tongs and brush with some more salad dressing. Bake another 40 minutes or until cooked through. Cook time will vary based on the actual weight of your chicken pieces-allow 15 minutes per pound plus 10-15 extra minutes to calculate the total cooking time.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the potatoes cut-side down over the parmesan cheese in the baking dish. Pour the melted butter into the bottom of the baking dish, then sprinkle with garlic powder, then parmesan cheese. In a large bowl toss the potato halves in olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake for about 40-45 minutes, or until tender.

Mix sugar, cream cheese and vanilla with mixer until smooth. Spread into a deep pie dish. Spread caramel topping on top, then sprinkle with toffee bits and nuts. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Just before serving, core and cut apples into wedges and arrange around the edge of the pie dish, alternating red and green slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x13 pan with cooking spray. Press the meatloaf into the pan. Mix the ketchup, brown sugar and mustard together and spread over the meatloaf. Bake at 350 for about 50 minutes.

Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat until skin is blistered and slightly charred, turning frequently. Add whole tomato to skillet and heat until skin is blistered and slightly charred, turning frequently. Cool tomato slightly and coarsely chop. In a large saucepan, combine tomato, onion, and garlic. Cook over medium heat until onion and garlic are softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in beans and broth, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, simmer 15 to 20 minutes. Meanwhile, heat oven to 425f cut tortillas into strips and place in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Bake for 5 to 8 minutes or until crisp. To serve, ladle soup into bowls and top with tortilla strips and cheese.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray an 8-inch pie plate with vegetable cooking spray. In a large bowl combine egg with melted butter. Whisk together flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt in a small bowl. Mix first four ingredients and enough milk to make a runny batter. Spray a pan with olive oil spray. Pour batter onto pan. Fry on each side at medium heat for about 45 seconds. Top with berries, honey, etc.

In a medium saucepan, bring milk, sugar, rice and salt to a boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat and simmer about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until mixture is thick and rice is tender. Remove from heat. Simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until mixture is thick and rice is tender. Simmer for 20 minutes

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Mix oil, and seasonings in a large bowl. Add chicken and potatoes. Toss to coat. Arrange chicken and potatoes in single layer in pan. Roast in oven for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender, turning potatoes occasionally.

In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add in the sugar. Beat on low for 2 minutes. Add in the milk, syrup, and vanilla. Beat 3-5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Use immediately or store, covered, at room temperature for up to 2 days. Reportedly, the icing tastes better if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla, mix well. Gradually beat in the flour mixture then add chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes. Let cookies rest on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing with a spatula to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Coat a 10- by 15-inch rimmed baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Place the chicken breasts on the baking sheet. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Mix well. Spread the mixture evenly over the chicken breasts. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes, or until the topping is golden and no pink remains in the chicken.

Cook the orzo until tender but firm. Drain in a colander. Rinse under cold water to cool, and drain well. Mix the orzo, zucchini, parsley, and mint in a large bowl with a large spoon. Whisk the remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Pour over the salad and mix with a large spoon.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a loaf pan with cooking spray. In a bowl gently mix all your ingredients until well combined. Transfer meat mixture in loaf pan and gently press down. Bake until internal temperature reaches 180 degrees, about 1 hour and 15 minutes. As an option you can brush the top of the meatloaf with a little extra wing sauce when you pull it out of the oven to give it a better appearance. As an option you can brush the top

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix ingredients together in a large bowl until well-blended. Roll flax seed cookies into tablespoon size balls. Bake 12 minutes for chewy cookies. Bake 15 minutes for crisp.

Place all ingredients in a large pan, stir. Turn down heat and simmer uncovered until thickened. This may take up to an hour. Cool slightly, spoon into jars. Close jars, cool completely, then keep refrigerated.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray baking pans with cooking spray. Using 2 teaspoons, spoon the mixture onto the baking pan. With the back of one of the spoons, smush the mixture down so it is somewhat flat. Bake the cookies for 20-25 minutes or until the edges are getting golden brown. Remove the cookies to a cooling rack.

Cook noodles in a large pot of lightly salted water until al dente. While the pasta is cooking, place the eggs, grated cheese, parsley, salt and pepper into a mixing bowl and beat with a whisk until well combined. When the noodles are almost cooked, melt the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Quickly drain the pasta and add it to the skillet. Toss briefly to coat it with the butter. Add the egg mixture to the skillet and using a flat wooden spoon, mix quickly together for less than a minute until the eggs and noodles become creamy and thick. Do not cook the eggs too long or they will scramble and ruin the dish. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet, fry bacon until crisp. Add onion slices and saute until onion is tender. Do not drain the bacon grease unless there is too much. Add cabbage and stir until onion is well coated with the bacon mixture. Pour beer into a 2 cup measuring cup add caraway seeds, mustard, sugar, salt and pepper and stir until well mixed. Pour over the cabbage in the skillet and mix well with an egg spatula. Cover with a lid and simmer until cabbage is tender.
Place pasta mixture in a large bowl. Add pasta. Cook 8 minutes. Add shrimp to pot. Cook 3 minutes or until shrimp are done and pasta is al dente. Drain. Place pasta mixture in a large bowl.
Place brisket in crock pot. Cover with lid and cook on low heat 8-10 hours. I like to cook mine a long time so they fall apart in the crock pot. Serve with brown rice and a green veggie.

Heat grill to high. Melt butter in a frying pan and fry mushrooms until tender. Add garlic and thyme and cook for another minute. Toast the bread, top with the mushrooms and then the cheese. Grill until cheese is brown and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Fry the corn in a pan in the olive oil until soft. Add the cauliflower, carrots, corn, onion, quick-cooking barley, bulgur, salt, pepper, vegetable broth, black beans, cheddar cheese, paprika, salt and pepper. Mix well. Add the chile pepper and tomatoes, continue sauteing until completely cooked through. Mix the rice with the sauteed vegetables. Mix the

Preheat oven to 190c grease a patty tin or use paper cups. Sift flour and baking powder. Cream fat and sugar until mixture is light and creamy. Add in vanilla essence. Beat egg and add it gradually to the mixture, beating well after each addition. Fold in the sifted flour with a metal spoon. Add a little milk if necessary to give it a soft dropping consistency. Mix in the raisins. Fill greased patty tin or paper cups half full with the mixture. Bake for 20 minutes.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil and half of the butter in a large, non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Spread the flaked almonds over a small plate. Sprinkle 2 slices of bread with chocolate, and top each with another slice. Dip sandwiches into egg mixture, then press into the almonds, to coat. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil and half of the butter in a large, non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Sprinkle 2 slices of bread with chocolate

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place chicken in glass baking dish. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients and whisk together until well blended and smooth. Pour sauce mixture over chicken. Bake chicken with sauce mixture for about 20 - 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. For best results turn chicken over half way through cooking.

Preheat oven to 400f. Rinse chicken and pat dry. Stir together dressing, butter, garlic salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Add chicken and toss well to coat with mixture. Roll each piece in crushed chips and place on a shallow baking sheet. Sprinkle with any remaining chips. Bake for 30 minutes or until crispy and lightly browned.

Heat oil in large high sided pan over medium heat. Salt and pepper each chop, put in hot oil. Cook about 3 minutes on each side or until nicely browned. To the pan add the orange juice, zest, onion, and white wine. Reduce heat to low cover and cook for 15 minutes. After 15 minutes remove pork chops from pan. Put them on a serving platter and cover with foil to keep warm. Add the cream of mushroom soup to the pan and whisk constantly over medium heat until the sauce is thickened. Pour over chops.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spread dijon on chops. Sprinkle rosemary, salt and pepper. Turn to other side and repeat. Place breadcrumbs on shallow dish. Coat chops on both sides in crumbs. Heat skillet on medium high heat. Drizzle small amount of olive oil. Heat. Brown chops for a couple of minutes on each side. Place chops in oven. Cook for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375f. Spray shallow baking pan with cooking spray. Pat salmon dry with paper towel. Place salmon skin side down in pan. Brush with 1 tablespoon of the butter and sprinkle with garlic salt. Mix bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, green onions, lemon peel and thyme in small bowl. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon butter. Press bread crumb mixture evenly on salmon fillets. Bake uncovered 15 to 25 minutes or until salmon flakes easily with fork. Serve immediately in a bed of cooked spinach, rice or pasta.

Place salmon fillets, skin side down, on foil-lined baking sheet. Coat fish with cooking spray and season with salt and pepper. Preheat broiler. Cook salmon 10 to 12 minutes or until fish is opaque. While fish is cooking, combine avocado, sour cream, mayonnaise, lemon juice, garlic, hot-pepper sauce, worcestershire sauce, salt, black pepper, extra virgin olive oil, fresh cilantro stem. Process, scraping down bowl occasionally, until mixture is creamy and smooth. Serve a dollop of sauce next to each salmon fillet.

Combine the red cabbage, carrot, onion and celery ribs in a large mixing bowl. To prepare the dressing, in a small bowl combine the mayonnaise, lime juice, zest, cumin, chili powder, sugar, salt and pepper. Whisk to combine. Pour the dressing over the vegetables and stir to combine. Cover and allow the slaw to sit for at least 30 minutes, tossing every so often to combine well. Top with raisins before serving.
Heat oil in 10 inch skillet. Add greens. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally for 4 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in honey, vinegar, and salt.

Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat and add the mushrooms and cook for 10 minutes stirring often until the mushrooms are tender and all moisture has evaporated. Remove to a plate lined with paper towel and set aside to cool. Wipe pan clean. Sift flour, baking powder and salt into a bowl. Whisk buttermilk and eggs in a jug with a fork until well combined. Stir in mushrooms and chives. Brush frying pan with a little of the oil and heat over medium heat until hot. Using about 2 tablespoons of the mixture per hotcake, spoon mixture into pan and cook for about 2 minutes, until bubbles appear on the surgace and then turn hotcakes and cook for a further 1 to 2 minutes or until golden. Keep warm while cooking the remaining batter. Serve - suggestions given are reduced fat cream cheese or a dollop of tomato chutney and cottage cheese.
Place greens in a bowl. Add balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper. Toss thoroughly. Taste, and add more balsamic vinegar if desired. Scatter olives & feta cheese over the top and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a large cookie sheet. Beat butter and sugar in a large bowl with mixer at high speed, until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Combine flour, cocoa, cream of tartar, baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. Add to butter mixture. Mix until uniform. Mix in chopped cherries. Drop dough by tablespoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake about 10-12 minutes or until set.

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine first 5 ingredients in a bowl. Mix thoroughly and set aside. Heat oil in a heavy nonstick skillet over medium heat. Saut onion 5 minutes, or until softened. Stir in tomatoes and basil and saut 5 minutes. Add zucchini and saut 5 minutes, or until zucchini is tender. Stir vegetables into egg mixture. Pour into a buttered shallow baking dish and bake 15 minutes or until casserole is set. Do not overcook. Cut into wedges.

Preheat oven to 425f place a 10-inch cast iron skillet into the oven. In a bowl, combine the cornmeal, salt, sugar, baking powder, and baking soda. Whisk together to combine thoroughly. Add the dry ingredients to the buttermilk mixture and stir to combine. If the batter will not pour, add more buttermilk to the batter. Add 2 tablespoons canola oil to the cast iron skillet. Pour the batter into the skillet. Bake until the cornbread is golden brown and springs back upon the touch, about 20 minutes.

In a large saucepan, combine apples, juice, boiling water, cinnamon, sugar crystals, vanilla extract, honey. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and cool. Combine apples, juice, boiling water, cinnamon, sugar crystals, vanilla extract, honey. Combine apples

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Place 1 slice of cheese on each slice of bread. Spread bacon mixture on evenly and top with cheese. Spread butter on one side of each sandwich, cook with butter side down on medium heat for about three minutes or until light and brown. Spread

In a large skillet sprayed with butter-flavored cooking spray, brown meat and onion. Add mushroom soup, mushrooms, black pepper, noodles, nonfat sour cream, parsley. Mix well to combine. Simmer 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Sim

Put chocolate chips and butterscotch chips in the saucepan. Put the saucepan on the burner and turn on the stove to low. Stir and stir until the mixture is melted and smooth. Remove saucepan from heat. Turn off the burner and quickly add the chow mein noodles and the peanuts. Mix and stir until they are evenly coated. Cover the cookie sheets with wax paper. Drop the candy by teaspoonfuls onto the wax paper-covered cookie sheets. Put the cookie sheets into the refrigerator to cool the candies. When they are cool, take them off the waxed paper. Put them in plastic bags. Keep them in the refrigerator.

Heat oil in medium saute pan or saucepan over medium-high heat. Fry onions until crisp and reddish-brown, about 10 minutes, then drain on paper towels. Put garlic and chile in saucepan and fry for 20 seconds or until just beginning to brown. Add lentils and water. Partially cover and cook for 30-35 minutes, or until lentils are soft. Serve lentils with onions on top.

Scoop the avocado out of the skin into a bowl. Coarsely mash with fork or potato masher. Add all other ingredients except the lime juice. Lightly blend - authentic guac is chunky, not pureed. Squeeze in lime juice, mix gently and taste for seasoning adjustments. Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate if desired.

Heat oil in large skillet over high heat. Add green beans and saute till beans are just tender, about 5 minutes. In a small bowl stir together soy sauce, minced garlic, honey and ginger. Pour over green beans in skillet and boil until sauce thickens and coats vegetables, about 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Stir together oil & garlic, then using a pastry brush, brush one side of each bread slice with the oil mixture. Place bread slices on a baking sheet & bake about 10 minutes or until tops of bread slices are golden brown. Meanwhile, in medium bowl, toss together eggs, apple, walnuts & salad dressing. Top each toasted bread slice with some of the peaches, roma tomatoes, garlic clove, red wine vinegar, fresh basil, salt & freshly ground black pepper, baguette. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 325f. In a small bowl mix together beef tenderloin, cream cheese, blue cheese, plain yogurt, onions, pepper, garlic, salt, parsley. Rub mixture all over tenderloin and place in a shallow roasting pan. Insert meat thermometer into center of meat, if desired. Roast uncovered for 30-45 minutes or until thermometer reads 140f for medium rare-medium doneness. Remember meat will continue to cook while standing. Remove meat, cover with foil, and let stand 15 minutes to let juices redistribute. While meat is standing, in another small bowl, stir together the sour cream and 2 tsp dijon mustard. Slice tenderloin. Serve warm with sour cream mustard sauce drizzled atop. Also great thinly sliced over a hearty salad.

This step will take approximately 20 minutes, so preheat oven to 350 while working on this step. Put macaroni to boil. In a medium pot heat butter and saut onions. Add milk, flour, salt and pepper. Bring to a rolling boil. Slowly add cheddar cheese, stirring while adding. Drain macaroni. Add macaroni directly to the cheese mixture in the pot. Pour mac and cheese mixture into large lasagna pan. Put in oven and bake for 30 minutes or until top is bubbly and golden brown.

Cook rice beans in boiling water for 4-5 minutes until tender, but still crisp. Add chicken stock, long grain white rice, olive oil, roasted red peppers, green bell pepper, garlic cloves, canned black beans, white vinegar, hot pepper sauce, fresh cilantropreparation:Cook rice beans in boiling water for 4-5 minutes until tender, but still crisp. Add chicken stock, long grain white rice, olive oil, roasted red peppers, green bell pepper, garlic cloves, canned black beans, white vinegar, hot pepper sauce, fresh cilantropreparation:Cook rice beans in boiling water for 4-5 minutes

Slice avocado lengthwise. Remove pit and scoop avocado into a small bowl. Add mayonnaise, lime juice, worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, garlic salt and pepper. Stir and mash the ingredients together until guacamole is preferred consistency. Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate if desired.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Mix oil, and seasonings in a large bowl. Add chicken and potatoes. Toss to coat. Roast in oven for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender, turning potatoes occasionally.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brush the 1 tbsp melted butter into a square baking dish. Beat the eggs, sour cream, milk and mustard together until well blended. Stir in the scallions, swiss cheese, salt and paprika. Pour into the buttered baking dish. Bake at 350 for about 30-35 minutes or until eggs are set but still moist.

Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the pork chops and cook until tender, about 5 minutes on each side. Remove the pork chops from the pan and place on a cooling rack to dry slightly while you heat the oil in a large frying pan until it sizzles if water is dripped into it. Cook the pork chops until they are a deep golden color, about 5 to 7 minutes on each side.

Preheat oven to 400f. Combine flour and sugar in a large bowl or food processor. Add margarine and process, or mix, until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add cold water, one tablespoon at a time, and process, or mix, until a manageable dough forms. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and roll into a 12-inch circle. Press dough into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie pan or removable-bottom tart pan. Prick the bottom all over with a fork, cover dough with foil and fill with dried beans or rice. Bake 10 minutes. Remove beans and foil and bake until crust is golden brown, about 20 minutes more. Remove from oven and cool completely on a wire rack. Yields 8 slices per crust.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Put sweet potatoes in a medium saucepan with water to cover. Cook over medium high heat until tender. Drain and mash. In a large bowl, mix together the sweet potatoes, white sugar, eggs, salt, butter, milk and vanilla extract. Mix until smooth. Transfer to a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. In a medium bowl, mix together the brown sugar and flour. Cut in the butter until the mixture is coarse. Stir in the pecans. Sprinkle the mixture over the sweet pototato mixture. Bake in the preheated oven 30 minutes, or until the topping is lightly brown.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl combine first seven ingredients, stir well. Lightly spray pam in a medium size casserole dish and pour in bean mixture. Place slices of bacon over top of beans. Cover and bake 30 minutes. Uncover and bake extra 15 minutes.

In a large nonmetal dish or resealable food storage plastic bag, combine all ingredients except steak. Mix well. Add steak and turn to coat. Cover dish or seal bag. Refrigerate atleast 4 hours or overnight to marinate. Place steak on gas grill over medium heat. Cook 10 to 15 minutes or until desired doneness, turning once or twice. To serve, cut steak across grain into slices. Place on serving platter.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly grease a standard size bundt pan, 9 x 13-inch baking pan, or two 9-inch cake pans. In a large bowl, mix together the yellow cake mix, sugar, oil, pumpkin, water, cinnamon and eggs. Beat until well blended. Transfer to the baking dish or cake pans. Bake for 45 minutes. For glaze, cook together the butter, whipping cream and brown sugar for 3 minutes, stirring. When slightly cooled, pour over cake.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place cut up potatoes in a single layer in a large baking dish. Srinkle with oregano, salt and pepper. Toss around alittle to coat evenly. Drizzle the olive oil over potatoes. Bake at 350, uncovered for about an hour or until potatoes are to desired tenderness.

In large bowl, combine first 4 ingredients. Stir until smooth, then mix in the remainder of the ingredients. Put mixture into a baking dish. Top with a thick layer of either crumbled potato chips or chow mien noodles. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes or until hot and bubbly.

Mix all ingredients in a small bowl and let stand for 3 hours. Process in a blender on pulse until seeds are bruised and broken. Add dry vinegar, salt, allspice, and water, mix well. Cover loosely, and allow to stand overnight. Refrigerate unused portions.

Preheat oven to 350. Pour melted butter into a 9x13-in baking dish. Add chicken, skin side down, sprinkle with seasoning salt and garlic. Turn chicken over, season and lay bacon strips on top. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Bake in the preheated oven for 45-60 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. Remove chicken, bacon and mushrooms to a platter and keep warm. Pour juices from baking dish into a small saucepan and whisk together with cream over low heat until thickened. Pour sauce over chicken and serve warm.

In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and carrot and cook until onion begins to brown, stirring often. Add sauerkraut, mustard, sherry, caraway, and brown sugar. Mix well. Add kielbasa and bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer, covered, for 10 minutes. Serve mixed with egg noodles, over potatoes, or with chunky rye bread.

Preheat oven to 425 f. Line a baking tray with parchment paper and set aside. Lay two spring roll wrappers on a clean work surface. Brush wrappers lightly with melted butter. Slice the bananas in half on the diagonal. Place one banana half in the lower third portion of the wrapper and cover with the chocolate. Sprinkle a little salt over the chocolate and top with the remaining banana half. Roll into a tight package. Continue until all bananas and wrappers are rolled. Place the finished banana rolls on the lined baking tray and brush tops and edges with butter. Bake for 5-7 minutes on the baking tray and serve when golden brown.

Preheat oven to 400f. Peel and cube squash. In a large bowl mix minced garlic and olive oil. Add cubed squash and coat with the oil mixture. Dump all ingredients out of bowl and in to a glass casserole dish. Any size will do really but it will cook faster if it is more spread out. Cook 40-45 minutes, stirring once or twice. Squash is done when it is tender.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray an 8-inch pie plate with vegetable cooking spray. In a large bowl combine egg with melted butter. Whisk until well combined. Sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt in a small bowl. Mix first four ingredients and enough milk to make a runny batter. Spray a pan with olive oil spray. Pour batter onto pan. Fry on each side at medium heat for about 45 seconds. Top with berries, honey, etc.

Place cucumbers in bowl. Add salt, toss and chill 1 hour. Drain cucumbers and return to bowl. Combine remaining ingredients in another bowl. Pour over cucumbers and toss to coat. Can be prepared 1 day ahead and refrigerated.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine spinach, cheeses, and seasonings. Lift up skin of each chicken breast and divide mixture evenly among them. Be careful not to tear skins. Smooth skin over stuffing. Tuck skin edges underneath to form a neat package. Brush chicken with melted margarine. Place in 2-quart baking dish. Bake uncovered for 45-50 minutes. Remove skin before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Place all ingredients in a bowl and beat together until mixture is smooth. Spread pumpkin seeds on a single layer on baking sheet. Bake for about 30 minutes depending on your oven. Stir half way through.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, beat the margarine, white and brown sugar together until fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla, beat well. In another bowl, sift flour, baking powder, and salt. Add to the creamed mixture, stirring well. Fold in butter brickle bits, and chocolate chips. Spread in a greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Can be frosted with chocolate frosting.

In a 4-cup measuring cup, heat 4 cups water in microwave to boiling. Place tea bags in water and let steep for 5- 10 minutes. Pour sugar into 2 quart pitcher and pour hot tea over it. Squeeze tea bags to get out any remaining tea. Add tea to pitcher and discard bags. Stir well. Chill until very cold and serve over ice with lemon.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Place halves skin side up on broiler pan or in shallow roasting pan. Broil 4 to 6 inches from heat 8 to 10 minutes or until skin is crisp. Drain. Heat oven to 325 degrees f. Place halves skin side up in ungreased 13x9 inch baking dish. In medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Spoon over hens. Bake 45 to 50 minutes or until tender, basting occasionally.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl, cream margarine and brown sugar together. Beat in eggs one at a time. Add vanilla. Sift dry ingredients together. Add to wet mixture. Stir in chocolate chips. Do not overmix. Drop onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.

In a large mixing bowl, stir together all ingredients except buns. Have 12 pieces of aluminum foil ready. Partially hollow out centers of buns. Fill each bun with hot dog mixture. Wrap in aluminium foil, sealing securely. Place on a cookie sheet and bake in a preheated 375 degree fahrenheit oven for 20 minutes or place on top rack of outdoor grill. Cover grill and grill for 15 to 20 minutes.

In a large skillet or frying pan, heat the oil and add the peppers and onions. Saute until the onion softens and is clear 5-10 minutes. Add the tomato puree and spices. Simmer for 20-30 minutes or until desired consistency. Serve warm with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Arange shrimp in a single layer in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Combine lemon juice with butter, garlic, worcestershire sauce, lemon pepper, and red pepper. Pour mixture over shrimp. Bake at 425 degrees fahrenheit for 8 to 10 minutes or until shrimp are done. Sprinkle parsley over shrimp. Serve immediately. Serving size is 3 ounces shrimp with 2 tablespoons sauce with 3 points per serving.

Combine all ingredients and bring to soft ball stage, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir until mixture thickens, becomes creamy and cloudy, and pecans stay suspended in mixture. Spoon out on aluminum foil or parchment paper. Makes approximately fifteen to twenty pralines, depending on size.

Wash then hull strawberries. Slice in half. Peel banana and slice into thirds. Place in a blender or food processor. Pour in juice and optional ice cubes. Whirl until pured and frothy. Pour into tall glasses and serve.

Preheat oven to 325f. In a large mixing bowl, cream your butter and sugars til fluffy and airy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour mixture until combined well drop by quarter cup measure on to an ungreased baking sheet. Bake 12 to 13 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from baking sheet and then cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place all ingredients into a large mixing bowl and mix until just moistened. Spoon into lined or nonstick, sprayed mini muffin pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove muffins from the tray and cool on a wire rack.

Heat oven to 400 f. Combine the oil, garlic, sugar, cumin, salt, cinnamon, and carrots in a shallow baking pan. Roast 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove from oven and add the raisins, lemon juice, and parsley. Toss well.

Place peach schnapps in a blender and process for 1 minute or until smooth. Cover and freeze for 3 hours or until almost firm. Transfer to a blender and process again for 30-40 seconds or until slushy. Cover and freeze over night. Remove from freezer just before serving. Using a fork, scrape into 2 dessert dishes.

Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Saute onion, stirring, until tender. Stir in the rice, raisins, broth, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer 15 to 20 minutes, or until broccoli is cooked and liquid is absorbed. Stir in almonds before serving.

Heat oil on medium heat using a large skillet. Add garlic & onions. Stir-fry about 2 minutes. Add shrimp and scallops, saute just until shrimp are no longer translucent, do not overcook. Serve over spaghetti topped with parmesan cheese and additional butter if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, butter, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, flour. Add to the creamed mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven about 15 minutes or until lightly brown.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine turkey cutlets, breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, sage, salt, pepper, eggs, canola oil, lemon. Spread top and bottom of halves of scaloppine with parmesan cheese mixture. Layer turkey on bottom halves. Spoon 2 tbs cranberry sauce over turkey. Add lettuce and scaloppine top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine chicken, red potatoes, sweet potatoes, fresh green beans, mayonnaise, nonfat plain yogurt, milk, dill weed, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, pepper, salt

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 12-cup muffin pan. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine spaghetti, eggs, parmesan cheese, and pepper. Evenly press mixture into muffin cups to form a crust. Evenly top each cup with pasta sauce, then mozzarella cheese. Bake 15 minutes or until bubbling. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Heat oil in a large wok or high-sided skillet over med-high heat. Add gai lan, fish sauce, sesame oil, soy sauce, fresh garlic cloves and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add soy sauce, garlic, and lemon juice. Continue to stir-fry until gai lan is crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Serve hot.
Drain and reserve liquid from fruit. Add enough water to make two cups of liquid. Pour pudding mix & liquid into a pan. Cook until thickened, stir in dry jello. Mix in pineapple and oranges. Chill.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla, mixing well. In a separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Stir in pecans. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 11-14 minutes or until light golden. Transfer cookies to wire rack to cool.

Place custard in a large bowl. In a large bowl, beat 1 tablespoon of sugar and 1 tablespoon of milk together until smooth. Add 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon stick and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla. Mix until smooth. Pour into tall glasses and serve.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place wax paper on a large baking sheet. Combine dry ingredients in a second bowl. Combine other ingredients in a second bowl. Blend the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Add chocolate chips. Drop by large spoonfuls onto the baking sheet. Bake 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. In a large bowl, cream both sugars with the shortening, margarine, eggs, and vanilla. Then, gradually add soda, salt and flour. Stir in chocolate chips. Bake 8-9 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place crust on an ungreased 14 in pizza pan. In a small bowl, combine cheese, mayonnaise, onion, garlic and oregano. Spread over crust. Bake at 450 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cut into wedges and serve warm or slightly cooled.

Preheat oven to 350f and lightly grease a casserole dish. Cover chinese cabbage with boiling water and cook for about ten minutes or until tender. Drain very well. Pour into a baking dish, cover and bake in oven for 30 to 40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine sausage links, pineapple tidbits, brown sugar, ground cinnamon, firm banana, pineapple chunks, orange marmalade, margarine, nutmeg, ground cloves, cinnamon stick, lemon juice, crushed pineapple, sugar, pine nutspreparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine sausage links, pineapple tidbits, brown sugar, ground cinnamon, firm banana, pineapple chunks, orange marmalade,

Heat oven to 400 degrees and line a baking tray with baking paper. Mix the sesame seeds, sesame seeds, five-spice and a little seasoning on a plate. Arrange on the baking tray, then bake for 25 to 30 minutes until crips and cooked through. Mix the soy sauce with the citrus juices and sogar to make a dipping sauce. Serve the chicken with little dishes of the sauce for dipping, plus lime wedges for squeezing over.

Preheat oven at 350 degrees. Combine the chicken, cheese, sour cream, refried beans, chiles, taco seasoning and cilantro in a mixing bowl. Fill each tortilla with 2 spoonfuls of filling mix. Fold tortillas and place in baking pan seam side down. When the pan is filled, pour enchilada sauce over the top of all the filled tortillas. Cover the pan and bake for 20-40 minutes.

In a large saucepan combine the chocolate, cream, butter and butter and heat over moderate heat, stirring, until chocolate is completely melted. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and a pinch of salt. Transfer to a bowl and chill for 4 hours, or until firm. Form mixture by heaping teaspoons into balls and roll lightly in peanuts. Chill on a baking sheet lined with wax paper for 1 hour, or until firm. Chill

Heat oil in a large wok or high-sided skillet over med-high heat. Add broccoli and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add broccoli and stir-fry until broccoli is crisp-tender, about 5-10 minutes or so- it should still be bright green, but fork tender. Cover with lid, and let steam until tender, about 5-10 minutes or so- it should. Cover with
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add pine nuts and almonds and cook for about 1 minute, stirring to combine evenly. Season with salt and pepper to taste, transfer to serving bowl.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add in the onion, carrots, and celery. Cook, stirring, until the vegetables begin to soften, 2-3 minutes. Add in the split peas, broth, and water. Bring to a boil. Partially cover pan, decrease heat to med-low, and simmer until the soup is thick, about 45 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. You can add fresh herbs. Fresh dill is recommended. Also can add meat and ham bones to make it richer.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Put the first 7 ingredients into a food processor bowl. Pulse until bread is very coarsely chopped, 4-6 times. Grease an 8 inch square baking dish and arrange the cherry tomatoes in a single layer. Sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture. Bake until crust is browned and tomatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees. Put a sheet of tinfoil on a cookie sheet. Spray cookie sheet with lite olive oil or other veggie oil. In a small bowl combine. Onion flakes, oregano, garlic, paprika, salt& pepper, mix well. Brush cut sides of the potato wedges with olive oil and sprinkle with the spice mixture. Place potato pieces cut side down on the prepared cookie sheet. Bake until underside are golden brown, about 30 minutes. Gently turn the wedges so the other side is on the cookie sheet. Bake for another 15-20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and golden. Serve while they ar piping hot.

Heat oil in a nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray and cook tortillas for 6 minutes. Drain. Add hot sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 3-5 minutes or until sauce is thickened and chicken is no longer pink in center. Place lettuce on warm tortillas and drizzle dressing on top. Roll up and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a greased 10 x 15 cookie sheet evenly with graham crackers. Combine brown sugar and butter and bring to a boil in microwave or on stovetop. Pour mixture over crackers and sprinkle with nuts and chips. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool in refrigerator. Cut or separate into bars.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a large bowl, cream brown sugar and melted butter. Add vanilla and eggs 1 at a time. In a separate bowl, sift flour, powder, and salt. Add dry mixture into wet mixture. Spread into a greased glass baking dish. Cook in oven until golden, 15-18 minutes. In a microwave safe bowl, heat peanut butter and cream on low heat. Stir until smooth, and spread over baked bars. Cool slightly and cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 400. Butter a shallow baking dish. Break cauliflower into bite size pieces and cook for about 10 minutes or til still slightly firm. Drain and rinse under cold water. Prepare the sauce by melting butter in a small saucepan. Add garlic& cook over med-low heat, stirring often, for 2 minutes. Stir in breadcrumbs, pepper and nutmeg. Stir constantly until mixture thickens, about 3 minutes. Spoon over cauliflower. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes or til cheese is melted and bubbly.
Preheat oven to 375f. Preheat oven to 350f. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until tester inserted in the centre of a muffin comes out clean. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes,

Heat oven to 400 f. Combine the oil, garlic, sugar, cumin, salt, cinnamon, and carrots in a shallow baking pan. Roast 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove from oven and add the raisins, lemon juice, and parsley. Toss well.

In a large mixing bowl combine all the ingredients except cream cheese. Mix well and chill for 2 to 3 hours. Shape the mixture into a ball, or put it in an attractive serving dish. Another serving option is to press the dip into a lightly greased ring mold. If served as a cheese ball or spread, surround it with the chutney preserves or put the preserves on the side. If served as a mold, fill the center with the chutney preserves or put the preserves on the side. Serve with crackers. Melba rounds or triscuits are good choices for this dip.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute the beef and onion for 5 to 10 minutes, or until meat is browned and onion is tender. Drain fat. Add the celery, chili, tomatoes, taco sauce and corn. Heat thoroughly, reduce heat to low and allow to simmer. Meanwhile, prepare the noodles according to package directions. When cooked, place them in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour the meat mixture over the noodles, stirring well. Top with the cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f for 25 minutes, or until cheese is completely melted and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Remove salmon from marinade and place on a rack over roasting pan. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, basting once with the marinade or until golden and white juices are just beginning to appear. Place salmon in 2-quart shallow baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Whisk balsamic vinegar, cornstarch, orange juice and brown sugar in medium saucepan. Add chicken broth and heat to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer, stirring until the mixture thickens. Arrange salmon on serving platter and serve with sauce.

In a large pot, heat oil in a pot and saute garlic until golden brown. Add onion, potato, rice, broth, parsley, whipping cream, butter. Stir, bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Add more water if soup appears too thick. Stir in cheese and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix the flour, salt, pecans, honey, pecans, dry breadcrumbs, butter. Brush pork chops with flour mixture. Fry in oil to a nice golden brown, taking care as the pork chops can burn rather easy. Turn often. Serve with mashed potatoes, a vegetable and gravy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a large bundt pan. Combine all of the ingredients for the cake and mix on medium speed for 2 minutes or until smooth. Pour batter into bundt pan. Bake for 35-45 minutes or until knife insterted comes out clean. Invert onto a plate. Combine ingredients for the topping in a saucepan. Boil mixture for about 2 minutes. While still warm, poke holes in the top and sides of the cake with a fork. Pour margarita mixture over cake.

Heat oven to 400. Cover broiler pan or cookie sheet with foil and spread asparagus in one layer. Spray with cooking spray and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook for 12 minutes or less. Heat butter in a small skillet on low heat until lightly brown. Add vinegar and soy sauce. Pour over cooked asparagus.

Preheat oven to 375f. Spray a baking dish with pam or other no oil spray. Place the cottage cheese in a strainer and drain for 5 minutes. Pack the spinach on the bottom of the dish. Add the sliced onion. Sprinkle on the adobe spice. Combine the eggs and cottage cheese in a food processor and puree until the mixture is very smooth. Pour over the spinach. Arrange the tomato slices on top. Sprinkle on the grated cheese. Bake in 375 oven until golden and the eggs are cooked apprx 25 minutes.

Dissolve jello in water. In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy. Add jello mixture. Beat until smooth. Stir in vanilla, fruit, soda, and pecans. Chill until mixture mounds slightly when dropped from a spoon. Fold in three-fourths of the cool whip. Pour into a 13x9 inch pan. Chill for 4 hours or until firm. Cut into squares. Garnish with remaining cool whip.

Scoop the avocado out of the skin into a bowl. Coarsely mash with fork or potato masher. Add all other ingredients except the lime juice. Lightly blend - authentic guac is chunky, not pureed. Squeeze in lime juice, mix gently and taste for seasoning adjustments. Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate if desired.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add spinach, onion, garlic cloves, tomato paste, vegetable stock, red lentils, spinach, fresh lemon juice, fresh ground black pepper, rolls. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to a simmer. Cook uncovered until the lentils are tender, about 45 minutes. Serve warm with italian crusty bread or flatbreads.

In a large saute pan combine the oil, garlic and herbs. Warm over very low heat for about 4 minutes. Add the beans and salt and pepper to taste. Toss gently. Cook over low heat until the beans are warm and have absorbed the flavors of the olive oil, about 5 mins. Remove from the heat, add lemon juice and toss gently. Arrange beans on a platter and surround with olives. Serve immediately.

Place meatballs in crock pot. In a medium sized bowl mix together all remaining ingredients. Microwave on high for approximately 3 minutes or until boiling. Pour over meatballs in crock pot. Cook on low for 3 hours, stirring every half hour. Bake 20 minutes to 25 minutes or until golden brown, and toothpick comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes cut into any size square desired and dip into your favorite sauce. Serve warm. These freeze very well and thaw in the microwave quickly.

Heat oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Add oil, garlic and ginger. Cook until fragrant but not brown, about 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add bok choy leaves and cook until leaves are wilted but stems are still crunchy, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes. Add sweet chili sauce, stir and let cook for another 2 to 3 minutes, tossing to coat all leaves. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Serve immediately and spoon leftover sauce in pan over bok choy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Put the first 7 ingredients into a food processor bowl. Pulse until bread is very coarsely chopped, 4-6 times. Grease an 8 inch square baking dish and arrange the balsamic tomatoes in a single layer. Sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture. Bake until crust is browned and tomatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.

Place each chicken breast between two pieces of wax paper and pound to an even thickness. Place bag in a small bowl. In a small bowl combine lemon juice, oregano, garlic salt in shallow dish. Whisk to combine. While wisking stir in olive oil. Add chicken turning once. Marinate 30-60 minutes turning half-way. Grill to your liking. Discard marinade. Top chicken with feta cheese, tzatziki sauce, and olives.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl sift together flour and baking soda, set aside. In a large bowl, combine butter and both sugars. Beat on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Reduce speed to low, add salt, vanilla, and eggs. Beat until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop heaping spoonfuls about 2 inches apart onto baking trays lined with parchment paper. Bake until golden around the edges and soft in the middle, about 8-10 minutes.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic, cilantro, chipotle chiles and cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is translucent. Add garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is translucent. Add cilantro and cook, stirring occasionally, until cilantro is translucent. Add cilantro and cook, stirring occasionally, until c
Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Mix dry ingredients and beer. Pour into a greased loaf pan. Bake 1 hour, remove from pan and cool at least 15 minutes before slicing.

Place green beans in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallots and saute until deep brown and crisp. Melt 1 tbutter in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Melt 1 t butter in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Whisk in mustard. Add green beans. Toss until heated through and evenly coated, about 4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Mound beans on platter. Sprinkle with shallots.

In a large saucepan, saute the mushrooms, carrots, celery, onion, and ginger in the olive oil until tender. Add the vegetable broth and bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 40 minute stirring occasionally. Puree soup in a blender or food processor. Return to the boil then turn off. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Coat a large baking sheet with butter flavored cooking spray. In a medium bowl, combine apples, brown sugar, lemon juice and cinnamon. Toss to coat apples. Place wonton wrappers on a flat surface. Drop apple mixture by teaspoonfuls onto center of each wrapper. Moisten edges of wrapper with wet fingers, fold over one corner to make a triangle and press sides together to seal. Transfer filled wrappers to prepared baking sheet and coat surface with cooking spray. Bake until wontons are golden brown, about 15 minutes. Place wontons on individual plates and sift with powdered sugar. Serve with ice cream on the side.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, combine tomato, basil, olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper in mixing bowl. Drain pasta and place in large serving bowl. Top with tomato mixture, sprinkle with feta cheese and olives. Serve.

Place tuna in a medium bowl and break into large pieces with a fork. Add tomatoes, onion, celery, fresh dill, fresh parsley, sweet onions, lemon juice, mayonnaise, extra virgin olive oil, salt, fresh ground black pepper. Stir to mix. Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes or up to 6 hours.

In a small saucepan, combine the water, sugar-free lemon jell-o powder, lemons, rind of, apple juice, fat-free whipped topping, frozen raspberries. Pour into container such as a bowl or individual cups. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

Combine beans, onions and parsley in a large bowl. Combine dressing, sugar and garlic. Pour over bean mixture and toss. Cover. Refrigerate at least 3 hours, stirring occasionally. Just before serving, remove bean mixture with slotted spoon to lettuce-lined salad bowl.

In a large saucepan, combine egg whites, water, sugar, vanilla, cornstarch, vinegar, whipped cream, fresh fruit. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until thick. Remove from heat. Add lemon extract and butter. Continue to stir until butter has completely melted. Pour into baked pie crust. Top with meringue, made with left over egg whites, and bake in 350f pre-heated oven until golden brown. Let cool and serve.

Heat grill to medium high. Grill chicken until juices run clear. Lower grill heat to low, then cover the top of each breast with mashed avocado, then pepper jack cheese slice. Cook covered for 1-2 minutes, just as long as it takes cheese to melt.

In a medium saucepan, bring milk, sugar, rice and salt to a boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat and simmer about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until mixture is thick and rice is tender. Remove from heat. Simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until mixture is thick and rice is tender. Simmer for 20 minutes

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Lightly grease a baking sheet. Place squash, cut sides down, on the baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes, or until a sharp knife can be inserted with only a little resistance. Set squash aside until cool enough to be easily handled. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Saut onion oil until tender. Add garlic, and saut for 2-3 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, and cook only until tomatoes are warm. Use a large spoon to scoop the stringy pulp from the squash, and place in a medium bowl. Toss with sauted vegetables, feta, olives, and basil. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan over moderately low heat, melt 1 stick of the butter. Continue heating, swirling the pan to prevent burning, until the butter turns nut brown. Transfer the butter to a medium bowl. Using an electric mixer on low speed, gradually blend in the powdered sugar and salt alternately with the milk and vanilla, until the frosting is smooth. Beat in the remaining butter, bit by bit. Refrigerate until mixture is cool and thick enough to spread. Keep frosted cake or cupcakes refridgerated, since the frosting has a tendency to soften and drip off the sides if it gets too warm.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until onion is translucent, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes with their liquid, pinto beans, lima beans, brown sugar, salt and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until lima beans are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in white kidney beans, heat through. To serve, ladle soup into warm serving bowl. Sprinkle with 1 to 2 ounces shredded cheddar cheese if desired.

Spray a large frying with cooking spray then cook the chicken until no longer pink. Mix in the water, taco seasoning, & salsa, simmer for 5 minutes. Add in the cheese then stir until melted. Turn off the heat & stir in the sour cream. Spoon the chicken onto the tortilla shells, top with the tomato & lettuce, if using.

Heat the oil in a medium size pan, melt the butter in the oil and then saute onions until transparent. Add garlic and the chicken. Stir until meat turns white. Add carrots, basil, and chicken stock, and simmer for 30 minutes or until the carrots are tender. Add pasta and simmer for an additional 15 minutes. After the soup has been poured into a bowl, add one tablespoon of lemon juice to each serving.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees celsius. Cut bread into 1. 5 cm thick slices but do not cut all the way through. Place oil, lemon rind, garlic, herbs, salt and pepper into a bowl. Mix well, brush over both sides of each slice of bread. Wrap bread tightly in foil. Place on baking tray. Bake 20 - 25 minutes or till hot. Slice all the way through and serve.

Heat oil and butter in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add shrimp. Saute 2-3 minutes or until shrimp turn pink. Turn shrimp with spatula. Cook shrimp 2 minutes longer on other side. Remove shrimp to serving platter.

Place potatoes and kale in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil then cover and reduce heat. Simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Drain well, then return potatoes to the pot. Add the butter, milk and salt and mash well. Stir in parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Mix oil, and seasonings in a large bowl. Add chicken and potatoes. Roast in oven for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender, turning potatoes occasionally.

Preheat oven to 325. Cream sugar and eggs until light in color and add vanilla. Mix soda into sour cream. Mix sour cream into egg mixture. Sift flour and cream of tartar together and fold into wet mixture. Pour into greased loaf pan and bake at 325 for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly grease a 9 x 5 inch loaf pan. In a large mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, salt and brown sugar. Pour in beer, stir until a stiff batter is formed. It may be necessary to mix down with your hands. Scrape dough into prepared loaf pan. Pour melted butter over top of dough. Bake in preheated oven for 50-60 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into center of the loaf comes out clean. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or so.

Heat oil on medium high heat in large skillet or frying pan. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine dry ingredients. Moisten chicken pieces with water. Dredge chicken in flour and crumb mixture. Quickly fry chicken on all sides until browned and crisp. Place in covered baking dish and bake additional 20-30 minutes to re-crisp chicken, serve.

Heat olive oil in a medium sized heavy skillet. Saute green onions until soft and add the shredded ham and stir until slightly browned. In a large bowl, beat the eggs and heavy cream together by hand. Stir in the onions& ham, broccoli, cheese and seasonings. Pour into a buttered deep-dish pie plate. Bake at 375degrees for 45-50 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Start checking it halfway through the cooking time. Let stand 10 minutes and cut into wedges to serve.

Preheat oven to 350f line a 9x13-inch baking pan with foil, spray with olive oil. In a small bowl, mix preserves and mustard, brush or spoon over chicken and bake an additional 10-15 minute or until done.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease muffin tins. Place all dry ingredients in a mixing bowl and mix up with an electric mixer. Add the liquids and mix smooth. Place 2 tablespoons of batter in the bottom of each of the greased muffin cups. Add 1 tablespoon of crunchy style peanut butter. Add the remaining bit of batter and bake for approx. 25 minutes or until a tooth pick comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut up the apples into small chunks and place them on the bottom of a lightly greased pie pan. Combine the sugar, flour, eggs and half of the vanilla into a bowl and mix well. Pour the mixture over the apples and sprinkle with remaining vanilla. Put into preheated oven for 20-30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 400. Bake for 20 minutes or until top is browned.

Place potatoes in medium saucepan. Add water to cover. Bring to boil. Cook 5-6 minutes or until potatoes are just tender. Add green beans. Cook additional 3 minutes. Drain. Mix potatoes, beans and remaining ingredients in large bowl until well blended. Cover. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Stir before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Drain the berries and reserve the syrup from one can. Stir the syrup in to the combined mixture of the cornstarch and half of the sugar. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Gently stir in remaining sugar, blueberries, and lemon juice. Let stand while preparing pastry. Line a 9-inch pie pan with pastry and fill with the filling. Dot with butter or margarine. Adjust top crust on pie, cuttin slits for the steam to escape, and seal. I recommend adding some sugar over the top after sealing. Bake for 30 minutes or until filling is bubbly and crust is brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute the beef and onion for 5 to 10 minutes, or until meat is browned and onion is tender. Drain fat. Add the celery, chili, tomatoes, taco sauce and corn. Heat thoroughly, reduce heat to low and allow to simmer. Meanwhile, prepare the noodles according to package directions. When cooked, place them in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour the meat mixture over the noodles, stirring well. Top with the cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f for 25 minutes, or until cheese is completely melted and bubbly.

Place egg yolks and water in the top of a double boiler and beat well with a wire whip or fork. Put all but 2 tbs of the butter in a small saucepan over moderately low heat until just melted. Add 1 tbs of the cold butter to the egg and water mixture and place over hot, not boiling, water. Whip constantly until egg yolks thicken slightly. Remove from heat and whip in the second tbs of cold butter. Gradually pour the melted butter into the egg mixture, beating constantly. Place over hot, not boiling, water cook until thickened, whipping constantly. Thickened hollandaise should hold the imprint when a fork or whip is drawn across the surface. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice, salt, cayenne pepper. Sauce may be placed in top of double boiler over hot, not boiling, water, covered, and kept until serving time. Serve with vegetables, baked or broiled fish, and shell-fish.

Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil then cover and reduce heat. Simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Drain well, then return potatoes to the pot. Add the butter, milk and salt and mash well. Stir in parmesan cheese.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add in onion and saute until golden. Add in sliced cabbage, carrot, boiling water, scallions, white vinegar, water, jalapenos, salt. Mix to combine and cook until the cabbage if crisp-tender and the liquid is reduced to a glaze. Season with salt.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Coat a 10- by 15-inch rimmed baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Place the chicken breasts on the baking sheet. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Mix well. Spread the mixture evenly over the chicken breasts. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes, or until the topping is golden and no pink remains in the chicken.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Mix together dry ingredients, first 5 ingredients. In smaller bowl mix together wet ingredients, last 4 ingredients. Add wet ingredients to larger bowl of dry ingredients. Mix well. Grease an 8-9 inch cast iron pan with pam. Pour batter into pan and bake for 1 hour.

Heat 1 tablespoon of butter in frying pan over medium heat. Add egg and fry until cooked to your preference. In a nonstick pan, fry ham until warm and lightly brown. Remove from pan and keep warm. On one slice of sourdough bread, layer slice of cheddar cheese, ham, slice of swiss cheese and fried egg. Top with other slice of bread. Brush melted butter on sandwich and place buttered side down in skillet used to fry ham. Brush melted butter on top. After a few minutes, flip sandwich over and fry until golden brown and cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Remove all visible fat from pork. Place in a shallow baking pan. In a small bowl, whisk together remaining ingredients except sesame seeds and onions. Brush honey mixture over pork. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. To serve, slice thinly and garnish with green onions.

Place chicken breasts in crock pot. Cover and cook on low for 4-5 hours or until juices run clear. Remove chicken and shred with two forks. Return chicken to roasting pan, reduce to low, and cook for 1-2 hours. Remove chicken and shred
